page.title: 03Spalding golf course.
page.content: The club is for private members only and has 650 members of all kinds.Established in 1920, the very attractive course has a full 18 holes and is surrounded by mature trees. Mr.A. Ward is the head greenkeeper and he maintains a high standard through- out the course. Every one of the 5807 yards is a credit to his care. The standard scratch score for the course is 68, though the course record is 65, by J.W. Spencer (professional) and G. Palmer (amateur). Green fees for a weekday are Â£6, but Â£8 for a Sunday. Many local boys and girls make quite a business of reclaiming lost golf balls in the rough and in the mud of the nearby River Glen. There is a well-stocked shop at the club selling all manner of golfing equipment (even "found" golf balls).
